intent: This exam is intended to test the student's knowledge of Java syntax. Students are just starting to learn Java, so the difficulty of questions should remain appropriate for their level of experience.

questions.question: Write a loop that prints out the contents of an integer array named "nums".
questions.answer: for (int i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) { System.out.println(nums[i]); }

questions.question: Explain why the following code does not compile: ```System.out.println("Hello, world!")```
questions.answer: The statement is missing a semicolon at the end.

questions.question: Write a method that uses binary search to find the index of an element in an array of integers. If the element is not present, return -1. You may assume the array is sorted.
What is the difference between public and private methods?
questions.answer: Public methods can be accessed from within any class, whereas private methods can only be accessed from the class they are implemented in.
